isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION - CONTROLLER/RELAY VALVE ( Figure 4 )

svcprocinfo.para: The controller/relay valve assembly is a controller mounted on a traction modulator and/or antilock relay valve.

svcsubproc.title: Controller
svcsubproc.para: The controller houses the electronic control unit that regulates the functions of the traction control and/or antilock brake system. The controller performs a system start-up self diagnostic test whenever the vehicle is started and then continues to monitor the antilock system performance during operation of the vehicle. The controller uses the instrument panel ABS warning light and Traction Active light to communicate system performance to the driver. The controller has diagnostic LEDs to provide system diagnostic information. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for more detailed information.

The controller mounts on the antilock relay valve. The controller is electrically connected through connectors to the wheel sensors, brake modulators, and the cab antilock wire harness. With traction control, an additional 2-way connector connects the rear chassis harness to the traction control solenoid (part of the controller/relay valve assembly). The relay valve functions as a service brake relay valve and contains no electronics of its own.

svcsubproc.title: Controller Power Supply
svcsubproc.para: The controller receives power from the battery through the ABS ignition relay.
With the relay energized, battery power from the relay terminal is applied through the cab and chassis harness to the controller connector.

Electronic EnginesWith Electronic Engines, the ABS controller is connected to the engine ECM. The ABS J1922 data link is a twisted pair of wires (Red positive and light Blue wire negative). When the ABS system sends an engine brake disable signal to the engine ECM, the engine ECM disables the engine brake. When the disabling signal is no longer present, the engine brake operation will resume.
Caterpillar 3406C (Mechanical Engine)With the Caterpillar 3406C mechanical engine, an Engine Brake Relay is used to disable the engine brake.
When the ABS engine brake relay is not energized, ignition power passes through the ABS engine brake relay providing power for engine brake operation.
The controller disables the engine brake by causing the relay to energize, opening the engine brake feed circuit.

svcsubproc.title: J1708/J1587 Data Link
svcsubproc.para: With electronic and mechanical engines, six-pin data link connector provides access for the Prolink Electronic Service tool to the ABS controller. International has Prolink cartridges available for this application.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock/Bob Tail Proportioning Relay Valve
svcsubproc.para: The antilock relay valve is a specialized service brake relay valve. The valve functions as a brake relay valve and provides bobtail proportioning as well, if the vehicle is so configured. If traction control is included, the antilock relay valve contains an electric solenoid for the feature. Vehicles can be configured four ways:

item.para: 04AZC - ABS with bobtail proportioning with tractors (04092).
04AZD - ABS with bobtail proportioning and traction control with tractors (04092).
04AZA - ABS With Tractor (04092) if bobtail proportioning is omitted (04WBN).

svcsubproc.para: With each of the above installations, a different combination of controller/relay valve is used. The porting on the relay valve portion is the same.

The relay valve has a special cover that permits the direct attachment to the controller. When the controller and relay valve are assembled together, the assembly is called a controller/relay valve assembly.

In the antilock brake system, the controller/relay valve serves as a relay station to speed the application and release of the rear service brakes. Incorporated within the relay valve is a quick release valve next to the service port, which provides for rapid exhausting of control air pressure from above the relay piston.
